questions.question: An Auto Scaling group of EC2 instances runs behind an Elastic Load Balancer. Web servers must be accessible only through the ELB, not directly from the Internet. How should this be configured?

options.A: With a CloudFront distribution in front of the Elastic Load Balancer
options.B: Denying traffic from the Internet in the web server's security group
options.C: Configure the web tier security group to allow only traffic from the Elastic Load Balancer
options.D: Install a Load Balancer on an Amazon EC2 instance

questions.explanation: Configure the web server security group to only allow inbound traffic from the ELB. Security Groups cannot create deny rules, so blocking all internet traffic would also block legitimate ELB traffic.

questions.question: A company is generating large datasets with millions of rows that must be summarized by column. Reports will be built using business intelligence tools. Which storage service meets the requirements?

options.A: Amazon OpenSearch
options.B: Amazon RDS
options.C: Amazon ElastiCache
options.D: Amazon Redshift

questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is a petabyte-scale data warehouse designed for heavy analytics workloads. It uses columnar storage and parallel query execution for high performance on analytic queries.

questions.question: Images must be encrypted at rest in Amazon S3. The company doesn't want to manage keys but wants to control who can access them. What should be used?

options.A: Server-Side Encryption with keys stored in an S3 bucket
options.B: Server-Side Encryption with Customer-Provided Keys (SSE-C)
options.C: Server-Side Encryption with Amazon S3-Managed Keys (SSE-S3)
options.D: Server-Side Encryption with AWS KMS-Managed Keys (SSE-KMS)

questions.explanation: SSE-KMS handles key management including creation, rotation, and deletion, while providing granular access control. SSE-C requires managing keys yourself, and SSE-S3 doesn't provide the same access control.

questions.question: A High-Performance Computing (HPC) application requires low network latency and high throughput between nodes in a single AZ. How should it be deployed?

options.A: In a partition placement group
options.B: In a load balancer placement group
options.C: In a spread placement group
options.D: In a cluster placement group

questions.explanation: Cluster placement groups provide low network latency and high throughput by grouping instances within a single Availability Zone, ideal for HPC applications.

questions.question: Your Business Intelligence team uses SQL tools to analyze data. What's the best solution for performing queries on structured data received at high velocity?

options.A: EMR using Hive
options.B: Kinesis Data Streams with RDS
options.C: Kinesis Firehose with RDS
options.D: Kinesis Firehose with RedShift

questions.explanation: Kinesis Firehose delivers real-time streaming data to Redshift. Redshift is optimized for analytics queries on structured data with SQL tools.

questions.question: A company stores important data in an Amazon S3 bucket. How can data be recovered in case of accidental deletion?

options.A: Enable Amazon S3 Intelligent-Tiering
options.B: Enable an Amazon S3 lifecycle policy
options.C: Enable Amazon S3 cross-Region replication
options.D: Enable Amazon S3 versioning

questions.explanation: S3 versioning keeps multiple variants of an object, making it easy to recover from unintended user actions. Cross-Region replication would also replicate deletions.

questions.question: An application for a social media website needs to perform complicated queries about users' connections, likes, and messages. Which database is recommended?

options.A: Amazon RDS
options.B: Amazon Redshift
options.C: Amazon Neptune
options.D: Amazon OpenSearch

questions.explanation: Amazon Neptune is a graph database specifically designed for handling interconnected data and social network relationships with high performance.

questions.question: A manual NodeJS script runs a couple times a week and takes 10 minutes. It needs to be replaced with an automated solution. Which option should be used?

options.A: Use a cron job on an Amazon EC2 instance
options.B: Use AWS Batch
options.C: Use AWS Lambda
options.D: Use AWS Elastic Beanstalk

questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is serverless with a 15-minute maximum execution time. It's the most cost-effective solution as you only pay for compute time consumed.

questions.question: A web application runs on EC2 instances behind an Application Load Balancer (ALB). Which protocols can be used for health checks? (Select TWO)

options.A: SSL
options.B: TCP
options.C: ICMP
options.D: HTTP

questions.explanation: Application Load Balancer operates at Layer 7 and supports health checks using HTTP and HTTPS protocols to ensure instances are healthy.

questions.question: A company plans to replicate core services to a Disaster Recovery site that can take over seamlessly. Other services will be switched off. Which DR strategy should be used?

options.A: Backup and restore
options.B: Pilot light
options.C: Warm standby
options.D: Multi-site

questions.explanation: Pilot light replicates core infrastructure with resources for data replication always on. Application servers are switched off and only used during failover.

questions.question: A website using HTML, CSS, client-side JavaScript, and images needs hosting. Which solution is MOST cost-effective?

options.A: Containerize the website and host it in AWS Fargate
options.B: Create an Amazon S3 bucket and host the website there
options.C: Deploy a web server on an Amazon EC2 instance
options.D: Configure an Application Load Balancer with an AWS Lambda target

questions.explanation: Amazon S3 static website hosting is the most cost-effective for static files, requiring no server management.

questions.question: How can a systems administrator specify a script to run on an EC2 instance during launch?

options.A: Metadata
options.B: User Data
options.C: Launch Template
options.D: AWS ECS

questions.explanation: User Data allows you to run scripts or set configuration details upon instance launch to automate tasks like installing software.

questions.question: To avoid data loss in EC2 Instance Stores and need a file system that scales automatically with LEAST management, which storage is appropriate?

options.A: Amazon EFS
options.B: Amazon S3
options.C: Amazon EBS
options.D: Amazon RDS

questions.explanation: Amazon EFS is a scalable file storage that automatically grows and shrinks, offering a simple interface for file systems accessible by multiple EC2 instances.

questions.question: When launching an EC2 instance with multiple attached volumes by modifying block device mapping, which block devices can be specified? (Select TWO)

options.A: EBS volume
options.B: EFS volume
options.C: Instance store volume
options.D: Snapshot

questions.explanation: EBS volumes provide persistent block-level storage, and instance store provides temporary block-level storage. EFS is not block-level storage.

questions.question: A serverless application must analyze S3 data using SQL. Data must always be encrypted. Which services should encrypt and query the data?

options.A: Use S3 server-side encryption and Redshift Spectrum
options.B: Use AWS KMS encryption keys and Redshift Spectrum
options.C: Use AWS KMS encryption keys and Amazon Athena
options.D: Use S3 server-side encryption and QuickSight

questions.explanation: AWS KMS provides server-side encryption for S3. Amazon Athena is serverless for SQL queries on S3 data. Redshift Spectrum requires a cluster, making it not serverless.

questions.question: A Kinesis consumer application reads slower than expected. Multiple consumers exceed per-shard limits. How can this be resolved?

options.A: Increase the number of shards in the Kinesis data stream
options.B: Implement API throttling to restrict requests per-shard
options.C: Increase the number of reading transactions per shard
options.D: Implement read throttling for the Kinesis data stream

questions.explanation: Each shard has limited capacity. Adding more shards increases the stream's capacity to handle more data volume and transactions.

questions.question: An organization wants to share static web pages that will generate large global views. Files are in S3. Which solution is most efficient?

options.A: Create EC2 instances worldwide and host the website
options.B: Use cross-Region replication to all Regions
options.C: Use the geo proximity feature of AWS S3
options.D: Use Amazon CloudFront with the S3 bucket as origin

questions.explanation: CloudFront is a CDN that caches content at edge locations globally, reducing latency. EC2 instances worldwide would be costly and complex to manage.

questions.question: A company must encrypt customer documents at rest in S3. They don't want to manage keys but want to control who accesses them. What should be used?

options.A: Client-Side Encryption with S3-Managed Keys (SSE-S3)
options.B: Client-Side Encryption with Customer-Provided Keys (SSE-C)
options.C: Server-Side Encryption with S3-Managed Keys (SSE-S3)
options.D: Server-Side Encryption with AWS KMS-Managed Keys (SSE-KMS)

questions.explanation: SSE-KMS handles key management including rotation while providing granular access control through KMS policies.

questions.question: A web application may be vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. What should remediate this vulnerability?

options.A: Create a Classic Load Balancer with AWS WAF
options.B: Create Anetwork Load Balancer with AWS WAF
options.C: Create an Application Load Balancer with AWS WAF
options.D: Create an Application Load Balancer with AWS Shield Standard

questions.explanation: AWS WAF protects against XSS attacks and is only available with Application Load Balancer. AWS Shield provides DDoS protection, not XSS protection.

questions.question: A big data workload runs on thousands of EC2 instances across AZs. DatAneeds concurrent access with extremely high throughput. Which storage is most suitable?

options.A: Amazon EFS in General Purpose mode
options.B: Amazon EBS PIOPS
options.C: Amazon EFS in Max I/O mode
options.D: Amazon S3

questions.explanation: EFS in Max I/O mode is optimized for highest possible throughput from many EC2 instances concurrently.

questions.question: A web application on EC2 behind an ELB requires all data in transit to be encrypted. How can this be achieved? (Select TWO)

options.A: Use NLB with TCP listener, terminate SSL on EC2
options.B: Use sticky sessions with ALB
options.C: Use ALB with HTTPS listener, install SSL certificates on ALB and EC2
options.D: Use NLB with HTTPS listener, install SSL certificates
options.E: Use ALB with TCP listener, terminate SSL on EC2

questions.explanation: NLB works at Layer 4 and can pass through SSL traffic with TCP listener. ALB supports SSL termination at Layer 7 with HTTPS listener.

questions.question: What's the most efficient service to establish network connectivity from on-premise to multiple VPCs in different AWS regions?

options.A: AWS Direct Connect
options.B: AWS VPC Endpoints
options.C: AWS VPN
options.D: AWS Transit Gateway

questions.explanation: AWS Transit Gateway connects VPCs and on-premises networks to a single gateway, acting as a cloud router for simplified multi-region connectivity.

questions.question: An HPC application needs 135,000 IOPS with replicated storage across all cluster instances. What's the most optimal and cost-effective storage?

options.A: Use EBS Provisioned IOPS volume with 135,000 IOPS
options.B: Use Amazon Instance Store
options.C: Use Amazon S3 with byte-range fetch
options.D: Use EC2 Enhanced Networking with EBS HDD

questions.explanation: Instance Store provides very high IOPS and low latency from physically attached disks. No EBS volume type supports 135,000 IOPS. Data is ephemeral but replicated across instances.

questions.question: A web application runs on-premise and in AWS. During coexistence, 80% of traffic should go to AWS, 20% to on-premises. How to distribute traffic?

options.A: Use Route 53 with weighted routing policy
options.B: Use Route 53 with simple routing policy
options.C: Use ALB to distribute traffic based on IP address
options.D: Use NLB to distribute traffic based on Instance ID

questions.explanation: Route 53 weighted routing policy splits traffic based on assigned weights. Assign weight 80 to AWS and 20 to on-premises servers.

questions.question: How can we be notified by email when an RDS database exceeds certain metric thresholds?

options.A: Create a CloudTrail alarm to send SMS
options.B: Create a CloudWatch alarm and associate an SNS topic
options.C: Create CloudWatch Logs rule triggering Lambda to send emails
options.D: Setup an RDS alarm to send emails

questions.explanation: CloudWatch alarms can trigger notifications. Create an SNS topic, subscribe your email, then configure the CloudWatch alarm to notify the SNS topic.

questions.question: A MySQL database needs migration to AWS with high availability and automatic failover across AZs. How to achieve this?

options.A: Use DMS to migrate to RDS MySQL Multi-AZ deployment
options.B: Use DMS to migrate to RDS MySQL using Schema Conversion Tool
options.C: Use DMS to migrate to Amazon EC2
options.D: Use DMS to migrate to Amazon EBS

questions.explanation: AWS DMS migrates databases securely with minimal downtime. RDS Multi-AZ provides high availability with automatic failover. SCT is unnecessary for MySQL to MySQL migration.

questions.question: A microservices platform using Docker needs AWS-managed infrastructure without managing EC2 instances. Which options deliver this? (Select TWO)

options.A: Use ECS with Fargate Launch Type
options.B: Use ECS with EC2 Launch Type
options.C: Put container images on GitHub
options.D: Put container images in ECS

questions.explanation: ECR is AWS's managed container registry. ECS with Fargate is serverless, eliminating EC2 instance management. You only pay for running tasks.

questions.question: An application processes 4GB files with sporadic uploads. Metadata extraction takes seconds. What's the most cost-efficient architecture?

options.A: Use RDS to store files, Lambda for processing
options.B: Store in S3, use EC2 to extract metadata
options.C: Upload to S3, use S3 event notification to invoke Lambda
options.D: Store in EBS, use EC2 fleet to extract metadata

questions.explanation: S3 event notifications trigger Lambda on file upload. This is most cost-effective with no running servers and low S3/Lambda costs.

questions.question: A shared VPC for several accounts must prevent consumers from connecting to other instances. How to set up with least effort? (Select TWO)

options.A: Create Anetwork Load Balancer (NLB)
options.B: Use AWS PublicLink
options.C: Use AWS ClassicLink
options.D: Create a Classic Load Balancer
options.E: Use AWS PrivateLink to expose as endpoint service

questions.explanation: PrivateLink allows private service access without exposing other VPC resources. Create an NLB as the service front end, then use it with the VPC endpoint service configuration.

questions.question: An application writes to DynamoDB and needs to run code in response to item-level changes. How to implement?

options.A: Enable server access logging and create Lambda mapping to S3
options.B: Enable DynamoDB Streams and create Lambda event source mapping
options.C: Create a script detecting data insertion
options.D: Use Kinesis Data Streams with DynamoDB as producer

questions.explanation: DynamoDB Streams capture item-level modifications. Creating event source mapping between Lambda and the stream triggers the function on modifications.

questions.question: A company needs single sign-on and AWS console access for an on-premise web application. Which combination is BEST?

options.A: Use IAM and Amazon Cognito
options.B: Integrate using CloudTrail
options.C: Use AWS STS and SAML
options.D: Use IAM and MFA

questions.explanation: AWS STS provides temporary security credentials. SAML enables SSO between on-premises identity provider and AWS. Cognito doesn't provide on-premises SSO.

questions.question: A decoupled application sends batches of up to 1000 messages per second that must be received in correct order. How to achieve this?

options.A: Create Amazon SQS Standard queue
options.B: Create Amazon SQS FIFO queue
options.C: Create Amazon SNS topic
options.D: Create Amazon Kinesis Analytics topic

questions.explanation: SQS FIFO queues are designed for strict message ordering. Messages are processed exactly once in order. SNS doesn't provide durable storage or ordering guarantees.

questions.question: To ensure EC2 instances can be launched in another AWS region for disaster recovery, what steps are needed? (Select TWO)

options.A: Launch instances using S3 API
options.B: Create AMIs and copy them to another region
options.C: Launch instances from the AMIs in second region
options.D: Copy snapshots using S3 cross-region replication

questions.explanation: AMIs capture EC2 instance configuration and state. Creating and copying AMIs to another region enables easy replication and launch in the DR region.

questions.question: A security team wants to limit service access across multiple accounts in AWS Organizations. Solution must be scalable with single permission point. How to accomplish?

options.A: Create an ACL to block account IPs
options.B: Create roles in each account to deny access
options.C: Create a global role shared between accounts
options.D: Create a service control policy in root OU to deny access

questions.explanation: Service control policies (SCPs) in AWS Organizations manage permissions across the organization. Attach SCP to organizational unit to control service access across multiple accounts.

questions.question: A multi-region database needs replication with master in EU (Ireland) and databases in 4 other regions for local reads. Which service is cost-effective?

options.A: RDS with Multi-AZ
options.B: RDS with cross-region Read Replicas
options.C: EC2 instances with EBS replication
options.D: EC2 instances with CloudFront

questions.explanation: RDS Multi-AZ provides high availability within a single region. Cross-region Read Replicas replicate databases to multiple regions, distributing read traffic locally.

questions.question: An application in a VPC uses Anetwork Load Balancer and will be offered to other accounts. What AWS service provides the service for consumption?

options.A: Amazon Cognito
options.B: Route 53
options.C: VPC Endpoint Services using AWS PrivateLink
options.D: API Gateway

questions.explanation: PrivateLink exposes your VPC application to other AWS accounts securely and scalably through VPC endpoint services.

questions.question: Incoming billing reports in CSV format need storage and infrequent analysis, then discard after 30 days. What's MOST cost-effective?

options.A: Write files to S3 and use Amazon Athena to query
options.B: Import logs to Amazon Redshift cluster
options.C: Use AWS Data Pipeline to import into DynamoDB
options.D: Import logs into RDS MySQL instance

questions.explanation: Amazon Athena is serverless for SQL queries on S3 data. You only pay for queries run, making it cost-effective for infrequent analysis.

questions.question: An RDS database needs reporting tool access without impacting application performance. How to achieve high availability?

options.A: Create cross-region Multi-AZ and read replica in second region
options.B: Move to EC2 and manage snapshots manually
options.C: Create Multi-AZ RDS Read Replica
options.D: Create Single-AZ Read Replica, then create second Single-AZ replica from it

questions.explanation: RDS Read Replicas offload read traffic from primary database. Multi-AZ deployment provides high availability while supporting reporting without impacting application.

questions.question: EC2 instances in a VPC need to make API calls to DynamoDB without using public endpoints. What's the MOST efficient secure method? (Select TWO)

options.A: Create a route table entry for the endpoint
options.B: Create a gateway endpoint for DynamoDB
options.C: Create an interface endpoint for DynamoDB
options.D: Create Anew private DynamoDB table
options.E: Create VPC peering between VPC and DynamoDB

questions.explanation: VPC endpoints provide private connections to AWS services. DynamoDB requires gateway endpoints. Create route table entry to direct DynamoDB traffic to the endpoint.

questions.question: An extremely popular application's DynamoDB database may not perform as required. How to enable microsecond in-memory read performance?

options.A: Enable read replicas
options.B: Configure DynamoDB Auto Scaling
options.C: Configure Amazon DAX
options.D: Increase provisioned throughput

questions.explanation: DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) is a fully managed in-memory cache delivering up to 10x performance improvement with microsecond response times.

questions.question: An application needs to retain user session information. Which options could store it? (Select TWO)

options.A: Sticky sessions on Elastic Load Balancer
options.B: Block storage like EBS
options.C: Amazon Redshift
options.D: Relational data store like RDS

questions.explanation: Sticky sessions bind user sessions to specific targets. ElastiCache Redis is a key/value store ideal for session data caching. Both provide session management solutions.

questions.question: A web application has public-facing web tier on EC2 in public subnets and SQL Server database in private subnet. How should security groups be configured? (Select TWO)

options.A: Configure web tier to allow inbound traffic on port 443 from 0.0.0.0/0
options.B: Configure web tier to allow outbound traffic on port 443 to the Internet
options.C: Configure database tier to allow outbound on ports 443 and 1433 to the web tier
options.D: Configure database tier to allow inbound on ports 443 and 1433 from the web tier
options.E: Configure database tier to allow inbound on port 1433 from the web tier

questions.explanation: Web tier needs inbound HTTPS (port 443) from the internet (0.0.0.0/0). Database tier needs inbound SQL Server traffic (port 1433) only from web tier security group.

questions.question: Videos in S3 shared via CloudFront must restrict access to specific IP addresses. Direct S3 access shouldn't be possible. How to achieve this?

options.A: Use signed cookies, create OAI, instruct users to log in with OAI
options.B: Use signed URL, create OAI, restrict S3 access to OAI
options.C: Use signed cookies, move files to encrypted EBS volume
options.D: Use signed URL and configure S3 as website endpoint

questions.explanation: Signed URLs restrict content access to specific users. Origin Access Identity (OAI) allows CloudFront to access S3 while preventing direct S3 URL access.

questions.question: An application on EC2 Auto Scaling should scale based on jobs to process. Compute layer is stateless. How to ensure loose coupling and durable job storage?

options.A: Create SNS topic for jobs, scale based on CPU usage
options.B: Create SNS topic for jobs, scale based on message count
options.C: Create SQS queue for jobs, scale based on network usage
options.D: Create SQS queue for jobs, scale based on queue items

questions.explanation: SQS provides durable message storage for decoupling. Scaling based on SQS queue depth matches processing capacity to workload. SNS doesn't provide durable storage.

questions.question: Three AWS accounts in different regions. Account Z has two Direct Connect connections. Accounts A and B need routing through account Z's Direct Connect. How to configure?

options.A: Associate Direct Connect gateway to transit gateway in each region
options.B: Associate Direct Connect gateway to one transit gateway
options.C: Associate Direct Connect gateway to virtual private gateway in accounts A and B
options.D: Create VPC Endpoint to Direct Connect gateway

questions.explanation: Direct Connect gateway connects to VPCs in multiple accounts/regions. Associate the gateway with virtual private gateways in accounts A and B for cross-account connectivity.

questions.question: A MongoDB database must migrate to DynamoDB within weeks. Database is too large for limited internet bandwidth. What should be used?

options.A: Migrate to S3 using bandwidth, then move to DynamoDB using DMS
options.B: Use SCT to extract and load data to Snowball Edge, then DMS to migrate to DynamoDB
options.C: Compress MongoDB and use DMS to migrate directly
options.D: Use DMS to extract and load to Snowball Edge, complete migration using DMS in cloud

questions.explanation: Snowball Edge moves large data volumes without bandwidth limitations. SCT converts MongoDB schema for DynamoDB. DMS loads data into DynamoDB after transfer.

questions.question: Data uploaded to S3 sporadically needs transformation triggered by event, then loaded to target store. What combination is cost-effective? (Select TWO)

options.A: Configure S3 notifications to trigger EC2 XL instance for ETL
options.B: Configure S3 notifications to trigger Lambda function for ETL
options.C: Configure CloudFormation to provision Kinesis for transformation
options.D: Use AWS Glue to extract, transform and load data
options.E: Configure CloudFormation to provision Data Pipeline

questions.explanation: Lambda processes S3 event notifications cost-effectively (serverless, pay per use). AWS Glue is serverless ETL service for transforming and loading data.

questions.question: A single volume requires 500 GiB size and needs 20,000 IOPS support. What EBS volume type should be selected?

options.A: EBS General Purpose SSD
options.B: EBS Provisioned IOPS SSD
options.C: EBS General Purpose SSD in RAID 1
options.D: EBS Throughput Optimized HDD

questions.explanation: EBS Provisioned IOPS SSD volumes support up to 64,000 IOPS per volume. Other volume types don't support 20,000 IOPS requirements.

questions.question: How to encrypt an unencrypted master RDS database with a cross-region Read Replica?

options.A: Enable encryption when creating cross-region Read Replica
options.B: Encrypt snapshot, create encrypted cross-region replica from snapshot
options.C: Encrypt snapshot, create encrypted master, then create encrypted replica
options.D: Encrypt snapshot, create encrypted master, then create encrypted cross-region replica

questions.explanation: Encryption can only be enabled at DB instance creation. Can't have encrypted replica of unencrypted instance. Must create encrypted master first, then encrypted cross-region replica.

questions.question: A web application on EC2 behind ELB in multiple regions (active/passive) uses Route 53 for DNS. How should Route 53 be configured? (Select TWO)

options.A: Use Failover Routing Policy
options.B: Set Evaluate Target Health to No for primary
options.C: Use Weighted Routing Policy
options.D: Connect ELBs using Alias records

questions.explanation: Failover Routing Policy is for active/passive configurations with automatic failover to standby. Alias records provide native integration with ELBs for DNS routing.
